content.question: The two gas samples represented in the graph above are at the same temperature. Which of the following statements about the gases is correct?

choices.label: The molecules of gas <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have a higher average kinetic energy than the molecules of gas <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

There are fewer molecules in the sample of gas <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than in the sample of gas <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Gas <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a smaller molar mass than gas <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Gas <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></math> has a greater molar mass than gas <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Gas <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a smaller molar mass than gas <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
